newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: EDP sale price follows recommendations.
newsitem.headline: EDP sale price follows recommendations.

text.p: The average price of 2,000 escudos per share set in the partial privatisation of utility EDP-Electricidade de Portugal conforms with recommendations by the global coordinator, the privatisations commission and the company, a government minister said.

"The average price in the first phase of the privatisation of EDP approved by the cabinet responds to a proposal from the global coordinators of the operation, EDP itself and the commission accompanying privatisations," Presidency Minister Antonio Vitorino told reporters.

On May 15 the government fixed minimum and maximum prices in the privatisation of EDP between 1,750 and 2,250 escudos. A stake of about 27.5 percent is expected to be sold in a special session to be held on Lisbon bourse on June 16.
The cabinet will decide what stake to sell at a meeting on June 5.
The global coordinators in the sale are Banco Portugues de Investimento, Goldman Sachs and ABN Amro Rothschild.
